snippet: The cartel, meeting in Vienna, faces huge challenges to its market position from rising production in the United States and elsewhere.
abstract: Members of Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries leave their 30-million-barrel-per-day quota for oil production intact; cartel faces huge challenges to its market position from rising production in United States and elsewhere.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

lead_paragraph: The cartel, meeting in Vienna, faces huge challenges to its market position from rising production in the United States and elsewhere.

headline.main: OPEC Leaves Production Quotas in Place
headline.print_headline: OPEC Leaves Oil Production Quotas Where They Are, but Cutbacks Seem Likely
